lines.text: We're oil and water, Cochran.
Not last night we weren't.
[running into each other at the train station]
Why can't you stay in one place?

[gasping for breath]
Why do you keep on scaring me?
Everybody else does, why not me? Come on.
[last lines]
Miss Crane? I'd still like to talk to you.
I have nothing to say.
[Cochran has taken a knee to the crotch during a fight]
Are you all right?

[in pain]
Yeah, I'm fine, I just like lying here.
Don't move!
Right.
[Emily dashes into the bathroom to dampen a cloth; returning, she places it on his forehead]
That's not where I need it.
You call this spring? I'm freezing to death.
Doesn't feel cold to me.
That's because where you come from, twenty below's a heat wave.
At least where I come from, the people aren't colder than the weather. It's a dry cold, not like here. Doesn't feel the same.
Yeah, till your nose drops off. I'm putting on the heat.
Don't look suspicious! A motor running but no move?
What are they gonna do, call the cops?
